message.content: {"responses": [{"question_id": "TT4G35A", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers write or improve lesson plans.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35B", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35C", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence assists teachers in supporting students individually.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35D", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence supports students with specific needs (e.g. multilingual learners, students with special education needs).", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35E", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers automate administrative tasks.", "response": "Strongly agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35F", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35G", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35H", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35I", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence jeopardises the privacy and security of student data.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35J", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches that teachers would use with students.", "response": "Agree"}]}
message.reasoning_content:
The user is asking me to respond to a survey about AI in education as if I'm a primary or secondary school teacher from Azerbaijan. I need to provide responses to all 10 statements using the provided response options: 'Strongly disagree', 'Disagree', 'Agree', 'Strongly agree', 'I don't know'.

Let me think about each statement carefully, considering a balanced perspective:

TT4G35A: "Artificial intelligence helps teachers write or improve lesson plans." - This is generally true. AI tools can assist with lesson planning. I would say "Agree"

TT4G35B: "Artificial intelligence enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities." - This is also true. AI can personalize content. I would say "Agree"

TT4G35C: "Artificial intelligence assists teachers in supporting students individually." - Yes, AI can provide personalized support. I would say "Agree"

TT4G35D: "Artificial intelligence supports students with specific needs (e.g. multilingual learners, students with special education needs)." - AI tools can be very helpful for these students. I would say "Agree"

TT4G35E: "Artificial intelligence helps teachers automate administrative tasks." - Definitely true. AI can handle grading, scheduling, etc. I would say "Strongly agree"

TT4G35F: "Artificial intelligence enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own." - This is a real concern with AI tools. I would say "Agree"

TT4G35G: "Artificial intelligence makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct." - Yes, AI can make errors. I would say "Agree"

TT4G35H: "Artificial intelligence amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions." - This is a real risk with AI systems. I would say "Agree"

TT4G35I: "Artificial intelligence jeopardises the privacy and security of student data." - This is a legitimate concern. 

TT4G35J: "Artificial intelligence suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches that teachers would use with students." - This is possible if AI recommendations aren't carefully reviewed. I would say "Agree"

Now I need to call the json_tool_call function with all these responses. Let me structure this as an array of response objects.
